intro: Pfaffia pulverulenta, commonly known as Brazilian ginseng, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with roots and leaves traditionally used in herbal remedies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to grow successfully. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is often considered a rare and valuable species.
